page.title: 17THE CHURCH IN MILDENHALL
page.content: {The church}was built in the 11th century by the Saxons.The interior of the church is Georgian and there are many interesting features including 2 identical pulpits.Also Mildenhall is 1 of only 3 churches in Britain to have shoulder high pews.Three years ago the church was badly in need of repair and Â£37,000 was raised to restore it to a good condition. There have been 2,200{baptisms}in the church and 1,172{burials.}In the graveyard only 200 graves are still readable. The{vicar}is Colin George Fox.He is a member of the Marlborough team.He has been in charge of the parish for 4 years. The electoral roll of the church shows that there are 53{members of the {church,}51 members from Mildenhall itself and 2 from Marlborough.
